Any questions regarding this program should be directed to Mr. Lyder at llyder@usd109.org.

If you have not already done so, it is still crucial to complete a free/reduced lunch application as when this program ends you will be charged at your respected eligibility status price.

USD #109 is an equal opportunity employer and does not determine the end date of the program.

Thank you for your patience and grace as we move forward with our plan to reopen. We are very excited to see students this fall!

East Elementary will have an Open House this year, but it will look a little different than it has in the past.

Preschool and Kindergarten students should bring their supplies to their scheduled time on Tuesday, September 1st.

Students in Grades 1 - 5 will have an open house on Monday, August 31st. We ask that families come to the time assigned by the first letter of their last name. Students will be able to find their classroom, meet their teacher, and bring their school supplies. Please limit those coming to open house to students and 2 adults.
4:30-4:50 - Families with the last name beginning A-K
4:50-5:10 - Families with the last name beginning L-S
5:10-5:30 - Families with the last name beginning T-Z

Class lists will be posted on the main office doors, doors A2, at 5:00 pm today, Wednesday, August 26th.

Be looking for more information tomorrow about the East Elementary Reopening Plan.

-Teachers will be in the hallways to help students.

'Tis the season; cold and flu season that is! Here is a handy checklist to see if your child is well enough to come to school, or should probably stay home to recover:

-Temperature of 100.0 or higher within the past 24 hours
-Vomited within the past 24 hours
-Diarrhea within the past 24 hours
-Excessive cough that would prevent learning to themselves and others
-Severe headache, too tired or otherwise unable to function
-If your healthcare provider tells you to stay home!

Any cough drops need to be accompanied by a note from the parent or guardian and given to the classroom teacher. Please do not send the lollipop cough drops to school. If you are sending any type of medication, please be sure to fill out the medication form available at your school office. The medication will also need to given to and administered by the school staff. If you have any questions regarding this, please feel free to contact USD 109.
